myLibs.Mqtt#

Module Contents#

Classes#

MQTTClient

MQTTClient is a class for managing MQTT connections.
class myLibs.Mqtt.MQTTClient(client_id, broker='broker.hivemq.com', port=1883, username='None', password='None', on_connect=None, on_disconnect=None, on_message=None, name='None')#

MQTTClient is a class for managing MQTT connections. It provides methods for connecting to a broker, subscribing and publishing to topics, and handling MQTT events.

connect()#

Connect to the MQTT broker.

Returns:

True if the connection succeeded, False otherwise.

disconnect()#

Disconnect from the MQTT broker.

Returns:

True if the disconnection succeeded, False otherwise.

subscribe(topic)#

Subscribe to a topic.

Parameters:

topic -- The topic to subscribe to.

Returns:

True if the subscription succeeded, False otherwise.

unsubscribe(topic)#

Unsubscribe from a topic.

Parameters:

topic -- The topic to unsubscribe from.

Returns:

True if the unsubscription succeeded, False otherwise.

publish(topic, message)#

Publish a message to a topic.

Parameters:

  • topic -- The topic to publish the message to.

  • message -- The message to publish.

Returns:

True if the publish succeeded, False otherwise.

on_connect(client, userdata, flags, rc)#

Handle the connect event.

Parameters:

  • client -- The client instance for this callback.

  • userdata -- The private user data as set in Client() or userdata_set().

  • flags -- Response flags sent by the broker.

  • rc -- The connection result.

on_disconnect(client, userdata, rc)#

Handle the disconnect event.

Parameters:

  • client -- The client instance for this callback.

  • userdata -- The private user data as set in Client() or userdata_set().

  • rc -- The disconnection result.

on_message(client, userdata, message)#

Handle the message event.

Parameters:

  • client -- The client instance for this callback.

  • userdata -- The private user data as set in Client() or userdata_set().

  • message -- An instance of MQTTMessage.

on_publish(client, userdata, mid)#

Handle the publish event.

Parameters:

  • client -- The client instance for this callback.

  • userdata -- The private user data as set in Client() or userdata_set().

  • mid -- Matches the mid variable returned from the corresponding publish() call, to allow outgoing messages to be tracked.

loop_start()#

Start the MQTT client's network loop in a new thread.

Returns:

True if the loop started successfully, False otherwise.

loop_stop()#

Stop the MQTT client's network loop.

Returns:

True if the loop stopped successfully, False otherwise.

get_subscriptions()#

Get a list of all current subscriptions.

Returns:

A list of all current subscriptions.

get_publications()#

Get a list of all topics this client has published to.

Returns:

A list of all topics this client has published to.
